data.title: 6 Places To Wed Like A Celeb In Charleston
data.meta_description: Say "I do" like a celebrity in one of these 6 Charleston wedding hot spots that A-list couples chose for their destionation wedding.
data.text:
The indelible charm and romance of Charleston beckons couples from near and far to celebrate their big day – including a number of celebrities who chose the Lowcountry to tie the knot. A-list couples from Blake Lively + Ryan Reynolds to Reese Witherspoon + Ryan Phillippe selected the Holy City for their dream wedding destination. You too can say “I do” in Charleston in high celebrity style. Think historic abodes, sprawling plantations and exchanging nuptials on a private yacht. Take a scroll through these hot-spot wedding venues to discover 6 Places to Wed Like a Celeb in Charleston.

1. Boone Hall Plantation

Actors Blake Lively and Ryan Reynolds choose Boone Hall Plantation for their lush, hush-hush celebration.

2. Middleton Place

Olympic Gold Metalist Tara Lipinski wed producer Todd Kapostasy and author John Carter Cash said “I do” to singer / songwriter Ana Alvarez at Middleton Place.

3. Governor Thomas Bennet House

Blogger and fashion influencer Caitlin Covington exchanged vows and danced the night away with now-hubby Chris Dorsch at The Governor Thomas Bennet House.

4. Old Wide Awake Plantation

Actress, author and founder of Draper James, Reese Witherspoon married actor Ryan Phillipe on the gorgeous grounds of Old Wide Awake Plantation.

5. Confederate Home and College

Actress and blogger Ava Amurri tied the knot to sports commentator Kyle Martino downtown at the historic Confederate Home and College.

Make your “Something Old” at one of Charleston’s picturesque historic homes. Take a peek into these 5 Historic Charleston Homes You Can Actually Get Married At.

6. On The Water

Celebrity chefs Alton Brown and Elizabeth Ingram took in Charleston’s skyline from the water for their destination wedding celebration.
